Dog

Chapter Info

Volume:

2

Chapter:

12

Japanese Title:

犬

Romanized Title:

Inu

Viz Title:

Dog

Pages:

19 (Excluding cover page. See Trivia and Talk page for further information.)*

Release Date:

October 13, 1997[ref]

WSJ Issue:

1997 Issue 46

Anime:

Episode 6 (p. 3-21)
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →

Chapter 12 is titled "Dog".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick Reference
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 Site Navigation

Cover Page[]

Color Spread: A two-layered triptych of Luffy, Zoro, and Nami; the top layer shows each in full, gearing for battle, while the bottom gives a close-up on each of their faces.

Short Summary[]

After escaping the Buggy Pirates, Zoro and Luffy rest in the middle of a street where the only inhabitant is a weird dog. While Nami comes back with the key for Luffy's cage as thanks for saving her life, the dog eats the key. Mohji, Buggy's vice captain, then appears to kill Zoro. With his lion Richie, he attacks the defenseless Luffy and destroys the cage in the process, freeing Luffy.

Long Summary[]

Buggy gloats about his reputation as a pirate in front of his crew. He orders them to find Luffy, Nami, and Zoro no matter what. Mohji arrives riding Richie and asks Buggy if he could take Zoro out. Buggy replies that he does not mind.

Elsewhere, Zoro is still carrying Luffy in a cage. Suddenly, he collapses to the ground out of exhaustion. The pair notice there is a dog sitting staring at them. Luffy comments about how the dog is sitting so still that you cannot tell if he is real or not, before provoking the dog into biting him when he pokes him in the head. Nami shows up and explains to them that they will likely be found if they remain in the middle of the road. Nami throws a key to the cage in front of Luffy, but before he can grab it the dog eats the key. Luffy attempts to strangle the dog in anger. The mayor of the town Boodle shows up, demanding that they stop hurting the dog, Chouchou.

Boodle takes them to his house to rest, and explains why the dog is sitting where he is. He feeds him every day, and he is guarding his owner's pet store. Ten years ago, the mayor's friend and Chouchou's owner opened the store. Chouchou's owner went into hospital three months ago and never returned, leaving Chouchou behind to guard the store. Chouchou is covered in wounds from fighting the pirates: he is aware his owner will not be coming back, but he still guards the store because it is his treasure. Boodle talks about leaving the dog and moving away, but he admits he has changed his mind many times.

Just then, they hear the roar of Richie the lion. Boodle and Nami run away, leaving Chouchou, Luffy and Zoro behind. When Mohji and Richie arrive, they find Luffy still in his cage. Luffy mocks Mohji's hairstyle, provoking him. Mohji boasts about being such a good animal trainer that every animal follows his orders, but Chouchou bites him anyway. When Richie pounces on the cage to finish Luffy, he frees Luffy instead.

As the pair prepare to leave, not noticing that Luffy is still alive, Richie smells the food inside the Pet Store, and Mohji tells Richie that he can eat the food.

Quick Reference[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Mohji and his pet lion, Richie, are fully introduced.
  • Mohji volunteers to hunt down the Straw Hat Pirates.
  • Nami managed to steal the key to Luffy's cage, but it is eaten by a dog.
  • Boodle, the mayor of Orange, and Chouchou are introduced.
  • Zoro begins to rest at Boodle's house.
  • The store is Chouchou's treasure.
  • The owner of the store has been sent to the hospital when he became too sick three months ago, but never returned, because he died.
  • Mohji catches up to the Straw Hat Pirates.
  • Luffy is accidentally freed from his cage.

Pirates Citizens

  • Roronoa Zoro
Buggy Pirates

  • Acrobatic Fuwas
Cocoyasi Village

Orange Town

  • Chouchou
  • Hocker (flashback)

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Thank you very much for all the fans letters each and every week. I believe that what I can do now is to repay your cheers with the energy of the characters. I'm gonna do it!!


毎週毎週たくさんのファンレター本当にありがとうございます。皆様の声援をキャラクター達の元気にかえてお返しする事が今の僕にできる事だと思っております。やるぞ!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by Awaikage. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

Trivia[]

  • As originally printed in Weekly Shonen Jump, every page of this chapter was colored—the Color Spread and first two "story" pages in full color, and the remaining sixteen pages in red-and-gray "part" color. This gave it—prior to the Digitally Colored Manga—the most color content of any chapter.
    • In addition, the Color Spread's original Jump printing ran three pages (with Nami's section being a fold-out linked to Luffy's). It was originally colored with a white background, the One Piece text in red, and different color backgrounds in each character's close-up: green in Zoro's, blue in Luffy's, and pink in Nami's. As this isn't always possible for reprints, different sources have handled the cover in various ways:
      • In all tankōbon reprints, it is turned vertically and resized to fit one page. Consistent with other color pages, it is grayscaled. Additionally, the One Piece text is removed.
        • In the Digitally Colored Manga, color is restored to the page, but Zoro's and Nami's backgrounds are colored dark blue instead of green and pink, Luffy's blue background is made lighter, and the background is colored beige. The colors of the entire cover are also generally made darker.
      • In Color Walk 1, the spread is kept horizontal, but resized to fit two pages. Instead of their original colors, Zoro's and Nami's backgrounds are colored dark blue, and Luffy's blue background is made lighter. The background is colored to resemble slightly-aged paper, like would be seen in a stereotypical treasure map. The One Piece text is preserved, but colored black.
      • In the One Piece Complete Collection, it is turned vertically and resized to fit one page, but kept in color. The One Piece text is removed, as are the background colors in the close-up sections. The rest of the background is colored a bright yellow.
The cover in Weekly Shonen Jump.
The cover in tankōbon releases.
The cover in the Digitally Colored Manga.
The cover in Color Walk 1.
The cover in One Piece Complete Collection.

==Short Summary==

While [[Nami]] comes back with the key for Luffy's cage as thanks for saving her life, the dog eats the key. [[Mohji]], [[Buggy]]'s vice captain, then appears to kill Zoro. With his lion [[Richie]], he attacks the defenseless Luffy and destroys the cage in the process, freeing Luffy.

==Long Summary==
[[Buggy]] gloats about his reputation as a [[pirate]] in front of his [[Buggy Pirates|crew]]. He orders them to find [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]], [[Nami]], and [[Roronoa Zoro|Zoro]] no matter what. [[Mohji]] arrives riding [[Richie]] and asks Buggy if he could take Zoro out. Buggy replies that he does not mind.

Elsewhere, Zoro is still carrying Luffy in a cage. Suddenly, he collapses to the ground out of exhaustion. The pair notice there is a dog sitting staring at them. Luffy comments about how the dog is sitting so still that you cannot tell if he is real or not, before provoking the dog into biting him when he pokes him in the head. Nami shows up and explains to them that they will likely be found if they remain in the middle of the road. Nami throws a key to the cage in front of Luffy, but before he can grab it the dog eats the key. Luffy attempts to strangle the dog in anger. The mayor of the town [[Boodle]] shows up, demanding that they stop hurting the dog, [[Chouchou]].

Boodle takes them to his house to rest, and explains why the dog is sitting where he is. He feeds him every day, and he is guarding his owner's pet store. Ten years ago, the mayor's friend and Chouchou's owner opened the store. Chouchou's owner went into hospital three months ago and never returned, leaving Chouchou behind to guard the store. Chouchou is covered in wounds from fighting the pirates: he is aware his owner will not be coming back, but he still guards the store because it is his [[treasure]]. Boodle talks about leaving the dog and moving away, but he admits he has changed his mind many times.

Just then, they hear the roar of Richie the lion. Boodle and Nami run away, leaving Chouchou, Luffy and Zoro behind. When Mohji and Richie arrive, they find Luffy still in his cage. Luffy mocks Mohji's hairstyle, provoking him. Mohji boasts about being such a good animal trainer that every animal follows his orders, but Chouchou bites him anyway. When Richie pounces on the cage to finish Luffy, he frees Luffy instead.

As the pair prepare to leave, not noticing that Luffy is still alive, Richie smells the food inside the Pet Store, and Mohji tells Richie that he can eat the food.

==Author Comment==
{{WSJ Comment}}

==Trivia==
*As originally printed in ''[[Shonen Jump|Weekly Shonen Jump]]'', every page of this chapter was colored—the [[Cover Page#Color Spread|Color Spread]] and first two "story" pages in full color, and the remaining sixteen pages in red-and-gray "part" color. This gave it—prior to the [[Digitally Colored Manga]]—the most color content of any chapter.
**In addition, the Color Spread's original ''Jump'' printing ran three pages (with Nami's section being a fold-out linked to Luffy's). It was originally colored with a white background, the ''One Piece'' text in red, and different color backgrounds in each character's close-up: green in Zoro's, blue in Luffy's, and pink in Nami's. As this isn't always possible for reprints, different sources have handled the cover in various ways:
***In all [[Chapters and Volumes|tankōbon]] reprints, it is turned vertically and resized to fit one page. Consistent with other color pages, it is grayscaled. Additionally, the ''One Piece'' text is removed.
****In the [[Digitally Colored Manga]], color is restored to the page, but Zoro's and Nami's backgrounds are colored dark blue instead of green and pink, Luffy's blue background is made lighter, and the background is colored beige. The colors of the entire cover are also generally made darker.
***In [[Color Walk 1]], the spread is kept horizontal, but resized to fit two pages. Instead of their original colors, Zoro's and Nami's backgrounds are colored dark blue, and Luffy's blue background is made lighter. The background is colored to resemble slightly-aged paper, like would be seen in a stereotypical treasure map. The ''One Piece'' text is preserved, but colored black.
***In the [[One Piece Complete Collection]], it is turned vertically and resized to fit one page, but kept in color. The ''One Piece'' text is removed, as are the background colors in the close-up sections. The rest of the background is colored a bright yellow.
